definitions.definition: a place where you can buy drinks and simple meals. Alcohol is not usually served in British or American cafes.

examples.text: There are small shops and pavement cafes around every corner.
an outdoor cafe serving drinks and light meals
They were having lunch at a cafe near the station.
We stopped for a coffee in our favourite cafe.

definitions.definition: a small shop that sells sweets, newspapers, food, etc. and usually stays open later than other shops

wordOrigin: early 19th cent.: from French café ‘coffee or coffee house’.
